title: The Satanic Verses
author: Salman Rushdie
description: A novel by Salman Rushdie blending magical realism with a fictional narrative based on the life of the Prophet Muhammad.
ban_reason: Accused of blasphemy against Islam; banned in several Muslim-majority countries.

title: Animal Farm
author: George Orwell
description: An allegorical novella by George Orwell about a group of farm animals who overthrow their human farmer.
ban_reason: Criticized authoritarian regimes; seen as anti-communist propaganda.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: J.D. Salinger's novel about teenage alienation and loss of innocence.
ban_reason: Banned for profanity, sexual content, and themes of rebellion.

title: The Grapes of Wrath
author: John Steinbeck
description: John Steinbeck's novel about the struggles of a family during the Great Depression.
ban_reason: Banned for its political themes and portrayal of poverty.

title: How to Read Donald Duck
author: Ariel Dorfman & Armand Mattelart
description: A Marxist critique of Disney comics arguing they reinforce capitalist and imperialist ideologies, especially in Latin America.
ban_reason: Banned under Pinochet’s dictatorship in Chile due to its anti-capitalist and anti-imperialist messages.

title: Goethe: Faust
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
description: A tragic play about a man who makes a pact with the Devil in exchange for unlimited knowledge and pleasure.
ban_reason: Censored for containing elements deemed inappropriate by the Nazi regime.

title: Suicide: A Study
author: Émile Durkheim
description: Émile Durkheim’s sociological study analyzing suicide as a social phenomenon.
ban_reason: Banned in some regions due to sensitive subject matter related to mental health and suicide.

author: George Orwell
description: George Orwell's dystopian novel about a totalitarian regime and surveillance society.
ban_reason: Criticized communist ideology and authoritarian governance.

title: Persepolis
author: Marjane Satrapi
description: A graphic memoir by Marjane Satrapi about growing up during and after the Iranian Revolution.
ban_reason: Deemed politically sensitive and inappropriate for younger audiences.

title: Lolita
author: Vladimir Nabokov
description: Vladimir Nabokov's controversial novel about obsession and manipulation.
ban_reason: Banned due to its explicit content and perceived justification of pedophilia.

title: The Diary of Anne Frank
author: Anne Frank
description: The writings of a Jewish girl hiding from the Nazis during World War II.
ban_reason: Banned for political and religious sensitivities in some countries.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: Aldous Huxley's dystopian novel about a future society driven by technological control and consumerism.
ban_reason: Banned for perceived anti-religious content and explicit themes.
